hub.newMeasurementDesc: Capture and analyze pupil size and reactivity
hub.sizeOnlyDesc: Quick pupil size measurement for both eyes
hub.reactivityDesc: Full pupil reactivity and RAPD screening
settings.title: Settings
measure.torchNotAvailable: Torch not available on this device
results.normalPupilSize: Normal pupil size range: 2-8 mm depending on lighting conditions.
results.physiologicalNote: Up to 1 mm difference between pupils can be physiological (seen in ~20% of the population).
clinical.noteSymmetric: Both pupils are symmetric and within normal size range.
clinical.notePhysiological: Mild asymmetry detected. Likely physiological anisocoria if stable in both light and dark conditions. Consider repeat measurement.
clinical.noteAnisocoria: Clinically significant anisocoria detected. Consider neurological evaluation. Check reactivity to light and accommodation. Rule out pharmacological causes.
clinical.noteSevere: Marked anisocoria. Urgent neurological assessment recommended. Consider third nerve palsy, Horner syndrome, or pharmacological mydriasis. Emergency department referral may be warranted.
clinical.noteReactivityBrisk: Brisk pupillary response to light stimulus observed.
clinical.noteReactivitySluggish: Sluggish pupillary response detected. Consider further neurological assessment.
clinical.noteReactivityFixed: Fixed pupil detected. Urgent evaluation required. Consider acute neurological emergency.
clinical.noteRapdPositive: Relative afferent pupillary defect (RAPD) detected. Suggests asymmetric optic nerve or retinal pathology. Ophthalmology referral recommended.
history.title: Patient History
history.noPatients.desc: Add your first patient to start tracking measurements
history.importDesc: Paste JSON data or upload a file
report.reportDisclaimer: This report is generated by PupilCheck, a clinical decision-support tool. It does not replace professional medical judgment. All findings should be verified by a qualified healthcare provider.
general.disclaimer: PupilCheck is a clinical decision-support tool and does not replace professional medical assessment. Always correlate findings with clinical context.
about.aboutDesc: PupilCheck is a progressive web app for clinical pupil assessment. It uses computer vision and optional machine learning to measure pupil size and reactivity at the bedside.
